website_summaries.verdict: Best for larger-framed hikers. Not ideal for most casual hikers.
pros: Serious hikers flock to this pack for its generous interior space and overall durability
cons: Too large and heavy for most light to moderate hikes

customer_reviews.title: Years of Service
customer_reviews.text: This has been my primary piece of luggage for 4.5 years now. Regardless of season, I only take what will fit in the pack. I've flown with it; I've driven with it (including the the luggage of my wife and 3 daughters). It's taken a lickin'- keeps on tickin'. It's even been washed. Lots of room- the two side compartments and the one on time are SO handy for toiletries, phone, etc. The highlight for me was taking it out of my truck up at my cabin when some random dude walking on the street says "Nice backpack." Yes...it is indeed a nice backpack. I expect it to last my lifetime. Peace.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Jo '77

customer_reviews.title: if you're doing some casual hiking this may be okay but I would strongly recommend against using it for anything else
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a 3 day backpacking trip. From day 1, the straps on this thing were killing me. I had to wrap a towel around my shoulders (under the straps) to make it bearable. Also, the strap that goes around the waist is enormous so if you have a normal sized waist (32-35 inches) it will never be tight enough unless you make a knot or something in one of the straps. Finally, one of the plastic pieces on the top snapped before we even left for the trip. Bottom line, if you're doing some casual hiking this may be okay but I would strongly recommend against using it for anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Mark in SD

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for an abroad backpacking trip in 2016. So far it's gone to three countries (two separate events) and it holds up great! It's big enough for two weeks worth of clothes, toiletries, extra pair of shoes and books and still has room for my extreme souvenir shopping. ***UPDATE JUNE 2019*** This pack has been to two different countries and three different states, soon to be four, and after three years it has held up GREAT! The only thing that's wrong with it now is the top holders have started ripping, but that's cause I have a tendancy to pull it up by those straps.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Smith

customer_reviews.title: This is EXACTLY what I've wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I hunt a long, LONG way back in the woods, so getting too hot and sweaty walking in just before sitting (sometimes in sub zero temps) is a a big no-no. This pack is huge, yet comfortable, and makes hauling in extra clothes a snap. And by extra clothes, I mean I can easily fit a hooded sweatshirts, sweat pants, a bulky parka, bulky snow pants, a liner jacket, size 13 ice king snow boots, hat, and choppers (heavy mittens), plus my lunch, drink, extra shells, etc. Wish I would have bought this years ago! Great waist buckle system really takes the strain off my back. A+!
customer_reviews.author: JD, Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Used it once for camping then re-purposed it
customer_reviews.text: Used to for camping one weekend in the Suwanee. It hold a TON of stuff. Not many pockets which is to be expecting from a bag at this price. Doesn’t seem like it would hold up to a proper beating but is great for a weekend camping bag. I’d say if I kept using it I’d get maybe 10 weekend camping trips out of it before it started to get holes in it. Re-purposed it as a bugout bag. (If you don’t know what that is YouTube it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Blackman

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it, looks and works great.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this backpack so much I bought a second one and use them for our bug out bags. They hold everything internally, 3-5 days of food, water, gear, and a fleece sleeping bag with plenty of room left over. We've taken them hiking and not had any problems, and they've proven to be somewhat water resistant as well. I replaced a big military style backpack with lots of molle attachment points with one of these because the design and internal room just proved better and will stand out less in an emergency situation. I can't attest to how well this would work in a months-long excursion, but for casual or emergency use, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Sprague

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to use as a short distance weekend pack. The waist straps ride up your waist and do not provide any support at all. There is also absolutely no structural support of the bag itself, therefore it just flops over and as you pack in more supplies, it begins to lean away from you once you put it on. Spend a little more money and buy something nice, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: great for first-time backpackers.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag for my boyfriend because he's never had a backpacking bag and wanted to try it out for our trip to Thailand. He loves it now and has been using it for all of our travel in place of his roller bag. He's 5'11" and this bag fits shim well. Side and top pockets are extremely useful. Not frame-fitted, and it doesn't have a zipper down the front are the two downsides, which means you should probably use packing cubes unless you want to dump all your stuff out when you are looking for something. Overall a good purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Light Bag for Light Loads
customer_reviews.text: This bag holds a great deal of stuff. It doesn’t have a frame and the waist belt only fits to a 32”+ waist. My shoulders were sore after a twelve mile hike with 30 lbs. The bag was loaded correctly. One of the side pockets started seperating from the main bag after this hike which was the first one with this bag. I am going to have to throw this bag away since the pocket is compromised. Color is great and the bag is light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great solid backpack
customer_reviews.text: Just received this in the mail. Great solid backpack. Only downside is apparently no bottom straps for tents or sleeping bags, but there's spots on the top that you can easily attach it. You could probably even fit them both inside and still have a ton of room left! I'm 6'3 and the bottom strap is a little high, but not that much of a bother whatsoever. I plan on taking this backpacking for a week in the mountains and then for a month long backpacking trip in Europe. If there is anything wrong with it that i find, I will update my review. Until then, nothing wrong and an amazing pack! For the price it's a steal
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Quality Not Good Enough Even at a Discount
customer_reviews.text: Rubberized lining that reminds me of the stuff we had in the army, long ago, which would eventually wear away and mold. Even the reinforcement points are a problem as taking stuff out and putting it in will just eventually wear them away and tear. I got this pack at a good discount, so I figured it'll be good enough, no matter what, but I returned it immediately because I wanted to save myself the trouble in the future.
customer_reviews.author: PBR118

customer_reviews.title: Bug Out Bag Ready!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack as a Bug out bag for my husband to carry. He is an avid hiker, doing 4-6 long backpacking trips a year. He likes the bag a lot. His biggest complaint is that it does not have a frame. After examining and packing and wearing he is pleased. I knew we weren't going to overspend for our emergency bags. His regular backpack was pricey.So for the price- it is sturdy, holds what we want it to, fits nicely in case we ever have to make a run for it. Hope we never have to use it!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for a great price
customer_reviews.text: At the same time that I bought this, I bought a Teton backpack which was about 30 dollars more and bigger by 7 liters. This one is still definitely comparable to the Teton and has a lot of space. The only downside is that it's basically just one big compartment with two small ones on the side, so you have to dig through or pack very wisely. Still, seems like a great, strong pack, and it's very comfortable. I got this for my fiance for our 6 day appalachian trail excursion as I have the Teton to carry the tent/sleeping pads, but this one probably could have fit the tent on the outside straps, too.
customer_reviews.author: sydney

customer_reviews.title: Strap tearing from bag after moderate use. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Used 5 times since purchased on July 24, 2015 and strap is tearing from bag. Very disappointed. Usage was not aggressive at all, and never exceptionally heavy. Sure the price was great, but strap failure while on vacation completely stinks, and that is what is happening (right now, grrrr).
customer_reviews.author: NYer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this backpack
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is total waste of money it got ripped after my first trip.I didn't even use it for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Emin Aygun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This backpack very comfortable on my shoulders and back since its straps are padded. The material is nice and pretty thick, although at first the smell might be an issue. The side pockets are big enough that I could pack in two regular water tumblers on each pocket). The stitching is nice, but mine tears up a bit on the top pocket. Not a problem, though, since it doesn't influence the zipper or anything. I don't mind the giant main compartment since I'm not picky with my packing, and I could pack a two-week stuff for backpacking, including sandals. All in all, it's practical and neat, and I could even fit this into the overhead compartment in the airplane.
customer_reviews.author: pratz

customer_reviews.title: Mine is camouflage!
customer_reviews.text: I take this on EVERY trip I take, love it I can pack clothes for a week. I need an iron when I get there but every room has those. Perfect for vacation travel. Straps are durable and comfortable. Won’t fit underneath a planes seat if it’s full, but will fit overhead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm a new hiker
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I'm a new hiker. I went on a forty mile hike on the Northeast Texas trail, which is a trail made out of an abandoned railroad bed. The guys I went with both had Ospreys which cost MUCH more than this pack. I must say, this pack showed out. I took 35 pounds of gear, which included my clothing, bedroll, sleeping bag, tent, food, and a two liter water pack as well as two additional liters of water. I can tell you this.... if you go on a hiking trek for forty miles, this bag is the least expensive and the least of your worries. Again, this was my first hike.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan cornett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect large light-to-medium duty pack
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for for an upcoming trip. While the durability may not be well-suited to a protracted wilderness camping experience, it will be perfect for running across the airport, and getting between hotels. For about 1/5 of the price of the more robust ones at Eastern Mountain Sports, it was exactly what I needed. Followup - After only a few uses, the draw string tore through the fabric making it impossible to use. Amazon was great about replacing it, though, and the new one seems to be holding up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Larry R

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack, TONS of space
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is huge. I bought it for a week long trip to Central America and it was able to hold a week's worth of clothes, my laptop, a bunch of rock climbing gear, and a few other random things. Even though it was almost completely filled, it fit almost exactly into the box at the airport to check the size of carry-on luggage. I haven't really pushed it to the point of abusing it but it looks well made and I'm not expecting any problems with it. I'll update this review in the future if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: The drawstring guide has completely separated from the front of the bag. I've only been using it for 5 months now and it's basically unusable. The design idea is great and the exterior pockets are perfect for smaller or fragile items. I also loved the top pocket for my wallet, passport and other items I need quick access to but want to keep secure. The zipper being toward my back is a plus. Overall, not a sound purchase because of the duration it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Shepherds

customer_reviews.title: Bought it 4 and a half years ago, still in heavy use
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this purchase, I travel a lot and I've used this backpack more times than I can remember. It shows signs of wear and tear like you'd expect, but after 4 and a half years it's still very much in use and holding strong. Considering the price, I don't think there's a better deal!
customer_reviews.author: Domagoj

customer_reviews.title: Stop searching because you’ve walked into a quality backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Had my trepidations prior to buying this, the reviews comforted me slightly, but upon purchase and usage, I couldn’t be more happy. Went backpacking through Europe for six weeks, took a decent amount of abuse. Extremely deep pockets on the side and on top, main compartment is completely deep, fit about a week’s worth of clothes PLUS towels PLUS shoes PLUS toiletries PLUS a portable hammock PLUS a blanket PLUS a smaller backpack to walk into town with. Did I mention that you can get it to fit as carry-on for flights? And it’s 30-40 bucks! Would recommend for any traveler in a moment’s notice.
customer_reviews.author: FIUgradRC92

customer_reviews.title: So Versatile and authentic!
customer_reviews.text: This bag has saved me on many occasions. Its great as a carry-on for flights, bus trips etc. Sturdy enough to put groceries in if you're like me and live alone with no car. I also use it to transport my laundry. Such a great bag and a greater price. The straps and design make it look like authentic military grade apparel as well, I've been mistaken for military while in the airport on several occasions and have even been offered military discounts while traveling because of this bag. Will buy again. A++++
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Great over all but no place to put a water bladder.
customer_reviews.text: Hiked up mount mitchell with it. Was very comfortable! The weight was distributed evenly, there wasn't any strain on my back. One downfall is that there isn't a spot to hold a water bladder but I just ziptided mine to the string that closes up the main pocket which worked just fine. Lost have plaves to hook things to and also there's many places to fasten to secure any items or to simply make the bad smaller. Grear buy but that green shown is definitely not a good representation of the ugly green it actually is haha
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, spacious, and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Took this bag with me on a month long vacation through SE Asia. The cheap price left me with some doubts as to its durability, but I now love this bag as my primary. It can carry a lot. I never even had it all the way full. Bugle and straps for compression. One piece of advice is a small bungee cord to loop from the bottom to the top when you're carrying smaller loads. The straps don't compress past a medium capacity. But love this bag! Also works well as a carry on. Fits comfortably in overhead compartments.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: This is not too as easy with a full load and a jacket
customer_reviews.text: Maybe not for you. If you a are grown man over 9'10', this pack may not be for you. For me, the strap that between the shoulder straps was hitting my neck. Also, the hip support, belt kept lowering, to the point there is little hip support. The hip strap needed to be re-tighten someone often. This is not too as easy with a full load and a jacket. Unfortunately, I purchase this pack in preparation to a two day hike, well ahead of it, and cannot longer return. I have given it three star only because, it seems to be well built and has good price point.
customer_reviews.author: AZ customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, I recommend if your on a budget (not used yet)
customer_reviews.text: Bag looks great, especially for this price! It has two big side compartments and a top compartment which I will be using for easy-to-grab snacks. I was able to fit 14 granola bars, 2 medium size (14oz.) trail mix bags and still have some room. There are two straps to keep everything tight, I weigh about 155 lbs and the strap that goes around my belly is a bit lose (max tightness) I can fit my fingers through it. This is my first hiking bag so I am pretty excited about it. However I didn't put it to use yet so more comments to come in 2 weeks when I get back, hopefully the 5 stars stay.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: This is a solid pack. It has the main ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid pack. It has the main compartment, two side compartments, as well as another up top. It seems really durable (seams/clips/straps held up through several airports and the trip itself, though I haven't had occasion to take it out again yet), and it holds enough clothing/bedding/food/tools for one person for a couple of days at least. I'm dinging it one star because it's not as large as you think when you're buying it, and the clips are destined to pinch your hands as often as not, especially if you're trying to secure your gear in the dark and/or when sleep deprived.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Laurence Hudson

customer_reviews.title: which is good if that's what you're after
customer_reviews.text: It's a large bag, which is good if that's what you're after, but the main part is just one large cavernous compartment. I found it was too easy to lose stuff deep inside it and I ended up getting a bag with more organization. Plus the straps for the lid don't allow you to tighten it down properly. Unless the main compartment is completely full, the lid just flaps around sloppily.
customer_reviews.author: Kaivon Paroo

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck!! I bought this for a lake trip that I was taking and wanted to be more hands free since we have to walk about 20 minutes from the ferry, to the house we're staying in. This holds just as much as the duffle we were taking up but is a lot easier on the arms/back. I only wish that it had a few more internal zipper pockets but I can make do with other bags inside of this one for organizing. So far, I love it! I think it would be a great carry on as well (if not filled all the way).
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: cheap alternative for occational outdoors adventure
customer_reviews.text: this is just OK, the integrated soft plastics are cheap., i grabbed mine from the top the plastics that hold the handle ripped right away. but it is a cheap alternative to more expensive backpacks, My advise would be if you plan on going on a lot of camping and hiking pay the extra money and get a good one. this is not something to keep for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smart

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My daughter went to a weekend music festival and this was perfectly. It fit everything she needed and then some. She said it had plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: Monica C. Whinery

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with this pack when I opened the box. You can't beat it for the price. It loads from the top and can hold a lot of gear. It is sturdy enough for my needs, but I have not tested it thoroughly yet. That is, taking it to Europe. I believe I can take it onboard if I do not pack it totally go the top. It would make a good bug out bag which I have also thought of using it for. It has two large side pockets. This bag will hold a lot of easy to get to gear.
customer_reviews.author: CMaxDavis

customer_reviews.title: Young girl in Scouting, first big camp backpack
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loved the backpack. It's perfect for long camping or short camping. It's big enough to easily carry a week's worth of clothing, and essentials such as extra boots or shoes. Plenty of room to spare. When camping is a way of life for scouts we need something that young scouts can carry their own gear in and this works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: R Bryant

customer_reviews.title: A great pack!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this backpack a few times now and found it to be excellent. After seeing the size, quality, and price both my brother and my friend have purchased one. The pack itself is very lightweight while still being sturdy. It is easy to carry and very durable. While I think some inside pockets would be nice its more of a personal preference. I can easily say that this backpack is of better quality and far cheaper than the packs I have looked at in several "Outdoor" stores. It would be a great deal at even twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Terry

customer_reviews.title: Waist strap is too large, makes it hard to shift weight away from shoulders
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this hiking pack, but the waist strap was too loose. I couldn't tighten it enough so as to lighten the load on my shoulders. I'm not a particularly small or petite person, but I am a woman. It appears this was designed with men in mind, with a larger waist circumference. I ended up using my shoulders to carry the weight, making the waist strap essentially useless and making my hikes/trips much less enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Hip straps are high for tall people. Otherwise excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It's a really great quality pack, very tough material. Lots of room for everything. I'm 6'2" and the hip straps come up to my lower ribs making them useless. Not really good for long trip climbing if you're that tall. I did hike a huge mountain with it and the straps helped keep it stabilized, but didn't take weight off my shoulders like they probably should have. Seriously great quality pack though.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: These backpacks are great, pretty tough and HUGE inside
customer_reviews.text: These backpacks are great, pretty tough and HUGE inside. I bought one a couple of years ago, took it out of the country and on many camping trips, my wife recently got this one. The straps are well designed and the waist strap helps with the weight if you load it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Butcher

customer_reviews.title: Amazing backpack!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband's birthday and it's perfect! We have a race this summer where we have to carry 20% of our body weight in a back pack, and this bag is big enough to hold lots of kitty litter (weight) and still fit comfortably on his back. The waist strap is strong, and the shoulder straps are really easy to adjust (even while wearing it!). I think if I had to find a flaw in it, it would be that there is no easily accessible "pocket" for things you may need without taking the pack off (i.e. water bottle, phone, keys, etc.). But all in all we are very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it! I bought it for a backpacking trip ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This bag is enormous! I absolutely love it! I bought it for a backpacking trip I'll be taking next week, and I'll update my review after I'm back. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars at the moment is that it feels like the waist strap isn't able to get tight enough around my body to really support the lower weight of the backpack. I'm a petite woman so it might just not be made for me. However, it might not be a problem in the end.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how nice this pack is for the cost. It arrived exactly as described and I have had no issues with the quality. I took it on a 5 day trip to Central America. I look forward to using this for many future trips.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Noone

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing. I had such hopes for this pack ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. I had such hopes for this pack but after about 6 trips, it is just falling apart. First the compression straps on the side ripped off, not a huge deal, then the plastic strap holders on the top started ripping, then a buckle cracked. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Aaryn

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé was SO EXCITED about this gift. It's got more room than I ever imagined. The color is beautiful and exactly like the picture. Plenty of room to fit a sleeping bag on the top. Even full to the brim it's not too heavy for me and I'm a small person. It's the perfect backpack and I wish I had one for myself! We go hiking and camping all of the time this is beyond worth having. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: used it 4 times and is still holding together like new. had it in the canyons of utah
customer_reviews.text: used it 4 times and is still holding together like new. had it in the canyons of utah, mountains of colorado, the river bottoms of tennessee and forests of southern illinois so far and havent had any problems with it. zippers are thick and well made, and the stitching is holding up good so far. my biggest load was 40 pounds and it held up to it like the much more expensive options
customer_reviews.author: mwarrenh

customer_reviews.title: Backpacks
customer_reviews.text: These backpacks are great. Have purchased these only for use for emergency equipment. Have not hiked with these so do not know about weather resistance. Seem heavy duty and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Paula J.

customer_reviews.title: It's a great bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a great bag for the price. I've gotten complements on it and my boyfriend wants one as well. They all think I paid big $$$ for this bag but it was only $30! I love how roomy it is and the straps are great. I've only used it for travel so far so I don't know how it would hold up in rain, etc... It has a zipper pocket on top and on each side. The main compartment has a drawstring closure on the top along with this big flap that clips closed over it.
customer_reviews.author: ✨

customer_reviews.title: Packed this baby to the brim and then some, ...
customer_reviews.text: Packed this baby to the brim and then some, for an over-nighter at Shedd's Aquarium. (Sleeping with the Fishes!) Hasn't seen any rugged hiking yet, but I didn't see any signs that parts were falling off as some reviews stated. I'll try to update after a few more campouts.
customer_reviews.author: VoltisArt

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I travel for work, and I have taken this bag with me everywhere for the past 3 years. This bag is a great value. Its just the right size for light use but also has the option to expand if you want to fit more. It fits my clothes, shoes and souvenirs well and I bring it with me on the airplane so I dont check a bag. You cant beat this for the price, it has a sturdy design that has lasted me 3 years of heavy use and it's waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Good Size - Needs Better Material
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Master Guide and Pathfinder Officer... This bag is used mostly for camping trips... it is spacious, but the quality isn't best... it's a thin material in the bottom... so soon enough you'll start to see daylight inside the bottom of your bag. But overall it's nice.
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit surprised at the quality. Much better than I expected. They haven't been field tested yet but right out of the bag they look very durable. Strong seams, thick heavy zippers and sturdy straps. I have a lot of camping stuff coming in days to come so I'll see how it all fits. The bags are larger than expected. Well suited for an adult of any size. My name is Ray and this is a real review. I will let you know more in the weeks to come.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Cheap! Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Great pack! I took it up a mountain in Colorado on a dayhike and it's holding up fine. I've also taken it around day hikes in my area and haven't had any durability issues thus far. I haven't packed it to the max, but the material quality feels like it would hold up fine if I did. Serious hikers who depend on their gear for their life may want to pass, but for a large day or overnight bag, this will do you fine.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, Just Don't Overload It
customer_reviews.text: Holds a good amount, but the weight distribution leaves a lot of the weight on the shoulders and the lack of a frame doesn't help in that respect either. As long as you keep the weight reasonable and/or don't use it for long hikes, it's a pretty decent pack.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Farwell

customer_reviews.title: I am loving this bag.
customer_reviews.text: The best feature of this bag is that there is no zipper to malfunction. It has a huge main compartment that is cinched by cord and a protective flap folds over and clips. The waist and chest strap placement is a bit annoying, but they are rarely needed. I have had well over 50lbs. in this bag while cycling, and it held up fine. It seems to be well made, and is quite attractive. I highly recommend this to anyone needing an oversized backpack.
customer_reviews.author: jermania

customer_reviews.title: I dont think I could ask for better.
customer_reviews.text: Havnt got to put this to the test,. I bought this for my husband to use as an emergency kit and for when we go hiking, which havnt been able to do yet. I can say there is a TON of space. The only reason I gave it a 4 star is because there is no spot for a hydration pack. I hadnt realized this when I bought it. Luckily there is plenty of room for water bottles :) For the price, I dont think I could ask for better.
customer_reviews.author: kyeager

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. Zippers are large and work very well
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Zippers are large and work very well. Size is perfect for a longer than a day trip and holds a lot of things. Only wish, I wish it had a Bolle system and/or more outside pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think I would enjoy backpacking very much so I didn't want to get ...
customer_reviews.text: It did the job when I went backpacking in Big Sur. I used it once then gave it to my sister. Even at the tightest the waist straps were too big around so my shoulders had to carry the weight. I didn't think I would enjoy backpacking very much so I didn't want to get a really expensive pack but since it's something I'll be doing more of I invested in a Kelty that is a lot better for me.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for Motorcycle Shopping
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this to have a way to bring home groceries on my motorcycle. I have saddle bags, but they are not normally on (only used for trips) and a nuisance to put on/take off (not big, just more than grabbing a backpack and hopping on my bike). I had a regular sized back pack, but it just didn't hold enough. This will hold a lot and secures well, so it won't shift while riding. Price was low, quality seems good - happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Panda

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product specially if you occasionally go for hiking or even regular trips. It looks durable I almost put everything inside and it doesn't feel it. You can use it instead of suitcases if you want to avoid extra cargo fee from US airways or United. The only issue is that it has only few functional places and one of them is extra spacious while the other ones are just OK. Then, you have to put all your stuffs in the main space and it might be inconvenient when you want to have access to them quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Etan Ehsanfar

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for the buck. When I shop on Amazon I only look for three things, which item has the most reviews? Which one fits my budget? Which one best fits my needs? This thing has a lot of space, I fully loaded a High Sierra Loops Backpack, placed that bag in this bag, and still had room for 3 days of clothes! Still had room for a sleeping bag as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ancient

customer_reviews.title: Best bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag a lot, the space if great, I was carrying a sleeping bag on the front elastic strap and lots of stuff on the side pockets and in the inside. It is comfortable to carry and the materials have a great feel of quality. I used it under light rain and it resisted the water. This is a great product for the price you get what you will expect of a product twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador

customer_reviews.title: Gone but never forgotten.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my red hiking pack. It went with me to Europe. And to Texas. And finally to Salt Lake City, Utah... where it was stolen. I was pretty upset about that. I mean, having my stuff in inside stolen sucked, but the pack itself was the real loss. I’m definitely going to try to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dyeyell Finney

customer_reviews.title: Not too big, great for people who are smaller sized
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good size for someone like me (5ft). It's not terribly big though, which is good for my height, but bad if you would like to be able to pack more stuff in it. I love the big pockets on each side which allowed me to add more stuff into it. It sits quite comfortably on me, and does not put a strain on me. I will definitely use it if I need to go on a short camping trip. The price is really great too!
customer_reviews.author: mynthe

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty impressed with this pack so far but it hasn't had a ton of use. I will mention that the bungee cordage on the front snapped almost as soon as I pulled on it. So I busted the pack back a star for that. The bag is very roomy and the straps fit my frame nicely. Lots of room in the side pockets and fits my small tent comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: codered1126

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but the lining for the interior cinch cord ripped within a month of using. Also, the plastic mounting on yhe exterior lid straps is thin and broke apart simply during tightening of the strap. I'd look for a different model.
customer_reviews.author: JSneen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the best purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the best purchase for the price! I'm just under 5'-3" and used this backpack for camping. had to hike about 1.5 miles with it and all my stuff and it was great. Fit all my clothes, extra shoes, sleeping bag and pad (I have small sleeping bag and pad), and water and any toiletries and snacks. I'm sure even if you had a small hiking tent, that could fit in there too. Plus it's very comfortable and distributes the weight comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: margaret undine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel bag!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is awesome! Bought it for a 2 week backpacking trip in Bali, and it worked beautifully. Just enough room for everything I needed, and then some, and very decent quality at that. I love the side pockets and how you can strap extra things to the outside, like my yoga mat. I'll be taking this bag with me to Ireland next month with no worries!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive and it works
customer_reviews.text: This was my grocery bag. The material is thin and light, yet surprisingly strong. It's held over 50 lbs on my bike ride home without causing me discomfort. Here are some points to remember: - It is not a fancy bag. - It costs $15. - It's a big bag I did not feel bad leaving it behind when I moved. If I ever need another hiking bag, I will definitely come back
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking pack
customer_reviews.text: Bag is big with huge side pockets and top compartment. Using it as a B.O.B. So I haven't used it out doors. I have about 40-50Ibs of gear in it. Feel's like it can hold up relatively comfy. I wish it had an interior frame, but with all my gear it holds up fine. The chest strap got stuck at one point. It took sometime getting it loose. But for the price it's a nice pack.
customer_reviews.author: Ikaika

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: On the surface, this seems pretty small. I was able to get all my gear for a one week PCT hike in it and felt like I had room to spare. It's comfortable to wear for distances, and it's pretty durable. I would, however, have liked to have a water bladder pouch, but that's something that can be overlooked and overcome simple enough. All in all, especially for the price, this is a fantastic piece of gear that I will likely look into buying again should this one break down in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Vineyard

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my wife. She is 5'6" She'd never used an internal frame backpack before, so it took some experimenting to get it to fit her comfortably. Luckily this pack is easy to adjust. No problems with seams, zippers or material - everything looks well put together. Although she only carried about 22 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: FANLig

customer_reviews.title: and I can't believe you can get this nice of a backpack these days from amazon for such ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who has started being interested in backpacking. He is 11 and this will last him for many years to come. so surprised I paid hundreds of dollars for my backpacks many years ago, and I can't believe you can get this nice of a backpack these days from amazon for such a great value!
customer_reviews.author: brandi

customer_reviews.title: It's good, considering the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's got a lot of room, which is great. My only real complaint is that the placement of the straps dig into my neck slightly which can be very uncomfortable. I can tell overall the pack is very low quality and crappy, but that's how they are able to sell it so cheap. For the price, it's a reasonable deal, but I recommend spending $100 and getting something really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. I'm not one to expect much from online purchases, but, dang. The thing is clearly very cheaply made. I pulled on the drawstring top to close it right after I took it out of the box, and the tab pulled off and unraveled the crappy nylon rope. The shoulder straps are also poorly designed, with straps that are about 4 inches wide and have no room for your neck to fit between them, so it gives you a headache pretty much immediately. I got this for a backpacking trip, I'm really sad that I can't take it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for camping or a go bag
customer_reviews.text: Got this bag for a bug out bag its made very well all the straps are stitched well together with plenty of ways to tighten the whole bag down so nothing moves around while its on your back its must have for any person who wants to have a good back pack for a bug out bag or for even going camping
customer_reviews.author: tim terry

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty enough to use for school
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in July for start of school in mid-September. Barely lasted til January when the straps broke. Can't be fixed and not even worth bothering as the rest of the bag didn't hold up either. Nearly $25 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: cheery28

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price. The large center compartment has pros and cons, though.
customer_reviews.text: I've waited a while to write the review for this one, so that I could get a few hikes out of it. It's a good pack. It's very lightweight and, as the center is one large compartment, it holds quite a bit. That is also a drawback, however. It honestly could use a few more storage pockets, a place for a water bottle, etc. A good pack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is not made of the finest materials nor is it the most comfortable backpack in the world. It is however a great deal when you also factor in the price. I used the pack as my luggage for a 3 week Europe trip - was able to hold an extra pair of shoes, flip flops, 8 days worth of clothes and all toiletries and towel. I wouldn't recommend it if you plan on using it as an actual hiking pack as the straps don't have loads of padding so it can get a little heavy on the shoulders. But once again, for a pack that only costs ~$35, its a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An OK beginner's DAY pack... but NOT a hiking/camping/trekking pack!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good beginner's day pack... it is NOT an overnight camping/hiking/trekking pack. It has no back support or bars. The straps are not adjustable. It does carry a lot. Not many options for pockets. Just the main bag, two side, and one top pocket that's it. The clamps are pretty cheap, they don't fully clamp unless you really fiddle with it. Again, an ok begginer's pack and for day hiking or car camping etc.
customer_reviews.author: P. Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! Like a Bag of Holding! (if yours doesn't come with a torn side pocket.)
customer_reviews.text: Would be a 5-star, but mine has a tear in one of the side pockets that I didn't notice until I had used it for too long. But the other pocket and the main part is REALLY GOOD. The ties allow it to shrink to half it's size. I always surprise the checkout folks at the grocers when they say "that won't fit," and I say, "watch this." It's like a bag of holding.
customer_reviews.author: Walkingphilosopher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pack!
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag as a large weekend band, or whenever I do not want to check luggage. This is a pretty durable bag and lightweight. It has enough pockets to fit all of the essentials. it has a very large middle pocket and very large side pockets. I see this bag lasting me a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Got good enough use out of it
customer_reviews.text: Got good enough use out of it, even after it ripped, but it ripped pretty early on. The bag itself wasn't even that heavy, just full with nothing more than clothes. The fabric wasn't very durable; not only did it rip near the mouth/opening drawstring, but it was somehow slashed when I checked it on a flight. That slash kept growing. For the price, I feel like I got my money's worth, but I wouldn't buy this again. It'd be worth it to invest in a better quality, more durable bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya D.

customer_reviews.title: Occasional Hiker
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at just how much stuff I could fit into it. It work for the 2 days hike that I went on. I'm not to fond of how I strap a small tent to the top and then it gets sloppy and top heavy, so I had to put a 2 towels to keep it up and from making it harder to walk, etc All in all a very nice backpack for not having any type of frame. It can be a bit uncomfy when wearing for long periods of time but I'm also about 5'3.
customer_reviews.author: VastraTaari

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but has cheap buckles and fits poorly
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's served decently. I wouldn't put anymore than 40 lbs in it, since it does not have the sturdiest of frames. The buckle on the chest strap broke after two uses, so I had to replace it with one from an old pack. The waist strap also sits poorly (at least for me), always wanting to be around my belly button instead of my waist. Because of that, I never felt like my hips/waist were holding most of the weight of the pack. It performs well in the rain, admittedly, not letting any of my belongings get wet. Also, the price was not bad at all, given the size of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everest Hiking Pack, Black
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! I'm using this as my Go Bag for work and I never imagined I'd use it as much as I do. This thing rocks!!! I did break the ties on the top, but that was my fault for carrying it around with them. The only bad thing about this is a wish it had a pouch in the back for my laptop. This is a must by if your're looking for a big bag to carry all your stuff.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: I bought this pack because I like Everest products
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack because I like Everest products. However, this pack is AWFUL! The pack has no support, and the chest straps actually go across your neck, nearly strangling you. And two out of the three strap holders broke before we even started hiking. If you are considering any kind of a strenuous hike, or will need a lot of gear, this is NOT the pack for you. Way too small, and poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN LARSON

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has a lot of space and the material feels really rugged. The clips, zippers, and rope material works well.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo I. Bontigao

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag great size
customer_reviews.text: Great size! Sturdy, side pockets are big and useful to reach items that you need immediately. waist belt facilitates when carrying. Fit 2 pillows, 2 sets of sheets and blanket, 2 days of clothing and pjs for 2 people, 1 towel, toiletries, 2 sandals, emergency kit, flashlights, and could fit more.
customer_reviews.author: Limarie

customer_reviews.title: I went on an 11mile hike with this and I felt comfortable and well-supported
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper than any outdoor store you'll find. I went on an 11mile hike with this and I felt comfortable and well-supported. I'm about 5'8 and weigh around 150lbs if that helps. Easy to fit a sleeping mat or sleeping back on top, and fill it with water, clothes, etc.
customer_reviews.author: V. Doug Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Backpact
customer_reviews.text: I am planning on using this for my next trip abroad. Last time we took 3 huge pieces of luggage and had to pay $200 additional for the trip there and back. Also most of the taxi's were not equipped to handle that much luggage and the train was a night mare. So this time we each have one. Mine is blue and her's is red. Packing on the necessities this time, lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pack for the cost. I have used mine a couple of times for traveling but not hiking or camping. I picked it up by the straps on top and the plastic mounts broke right away. I would prefer it with a zipper down the back so it could open like a gym bag. It is pretty big though and hold enough clothes for a long weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Good pack, waist strap is big on my slim11 year old
customer_reviews.text: Great, rugged pack. Holds everything a Boy Scout May need, plus extras. Waist belt is a little too big for my skinny 11 year old, so check that out before buying.
customer_reviews.author: JG Darco

customer_reviews.title: I forgot I ordered this a while back because several ...
customer_reviews.text: I forgot I ordered this a while back because several of the straps broke shortly after I bought it and I used it once on a week hike. Its was a pain. I am 6 foot even and the waist straps rode very high and uncomfortably. Has no back support either. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Hard Sharts

customer_reviews.title: Good item. fixed with a bit of tape.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag. Haven't had any issues with the zippers breaking off. Only issue i did have was that the mesh that tightens under the flap ripped on me but it was because I pulled it real hard trying to put something in it not because the bag lacks quality. If you want things to last you treat them accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Hector G. Romero

customer_reviews.title: If the waist straps and chest straps were better placed it would be a great bag for an ...
customer_reviews.text: Odd design. If the waist straps and chest straps were better placed it would be a great bag for an amazing price. For a long trek with lots of weight I'm going to have to just put out money for a better bag. Been using as a suitcase stand in though and works fine and fits a lot of clothes
customer_reviews.author: abacus

customer_reviews.title: Skinny women don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price and holds plenty of things. However, I took it on a two day trip and it hurt my shoulders... But I guess that a normal for 20 pounds of things. If you're really skinny this bags not for you because the waist straps are pretty big and wouldn't fit me properly and I'm not even that skinny.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: This one has got it in the bag.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on my 3 week backpacking trip to SE Asia and it worked great. Loved the extra side pockets as well. There was plenty of room and it was comfortable to wear. I didn't hike around too much with it attached to my back, but for getting from point A to point B it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Breia Goo

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price. The top straps ripped the rubber?plastic? so I can't carry a sleeping mat but come on; it's not a $200 bag! I put a piece of cardboard from the box it came in in the back of the bag to help since it doesn't have a back panel and I didn't feel the "bulky-ness" of the contents against my back. The waist straps are too big for anyone 34" waist and under fyi.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Came as it was supposed to. Its a little stiff out of the box but I think that it will loosen up with some use. I wish the side pockets had 2 zippers so I could put tall things in the pockets without concern for it falling out, but that's not really a big deal especially since there are additional straps. No complaints and I can fit a ton of stuff in it. Waist straps are an additional plus for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Seam with pull cord has come apart
customer_reviews.text: The seam at the top with the pull cord has come apart while “packing” for our first hiking trek. The bag it self seems to be durable and roomy. The material is thin at top that surrounds the cord. It should be better quality material as the cord will be used over many times. I hope the seller will replace it. Have not used it yet to document the performance...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Everest Hiking Pack, Red, One Size
product_meta.description: Color:RedMaterial 600D Polyester Dimension 24 x 13.5 x 8 in. Capacity 2930 in3 / 48 L Weight 3 lbs 4 oz / 1.5 kg

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars810 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
